project_name: Terraform and CI/CD for AWS Services with Multi-Environment Setup
description: Set up AWS infrastructure using Terraform and implemented a CI/CD pipeline to manage deployments across production and staging environments. The project involved the configuration of various AWS services including AWS CodePipeline, AWS RDS, AWS VPC, AWS ECS, Redis, AWS Application Load Balancer (ALB), Bastion EC2, AWS SES, AWS Route 53, and SSL certificates.

infrastructure.name: AWS CodePipeline
infrastructure.description: Set up AWS CodePipeline for continuous integration and deployment.
steps: Automated the pipeline to pull code, build Docker images, and deploy to AWS ECS.

infrastructure.name: AWS RDS
infrastructure.description: Set up AWS RDS for relational database management and connection handling.
steps: Managed AWS RDS instances for different environments.

infrastructure.name: AWS VPC
infrastructure.description: Set up an AWS VPC for secure networking and resource isolation.
steps: Provisioned VPC with subnets, route tables, and internet gateways.

infrastructure.name: AWS ECS
infrastructure.description: Managed AWS ECS for container deployment and orchestration.
steps: Deployed applications using AWS ECS and managed service scaling.

infrastructure.name: AWS Redis
infrastructure.description: Implemented Redis for caching and session management.
steps: Integrated Redis for improved application performance.

infrastructure.name: AWS Application Load Balancer (ALB)
infrastructure.description: Configured AWS ALB for load balancing across AWS ECS services.

infrastructure.name: AWS Route 53
